page.title: 19Burnaston Airfield
page.content: During the{1939-1945 War}an{aerodrome was established at{Burnaston,}Map ref 29o/307,mainly to train pilots,using the Tiger Moth plane. After the war it continued as a training ground for a private flying club. In the 1950's it quickly developed as a commercial airport, known as{Derby {Airport.}Regular holiday flights to the{Channel Islands and Glasgow}were operated using Dakota aeroplanes. The runways were grass and lit by oil flares with no major disasters occuring. The nearby Burnaston House,now mostly derelect, was used as a restaurant and bar for piolts and customers. Although small the complex housed offices and customs facilities. As wages improved and holiday traffic increased it became necessary to expand.
